title: Work passes
content:
Work passes
All foreigners who intend to work in Singapore must have a valid pass (commonly known as a work visa) before they start work. If you are engaging foreigners to work in Singapore, you must ensure that they hold a valid pass. Find out which pass is suitable, if they are eligible and how to apply.
Professionals
Pass type
Who is it for
Employment Pass
For foreign professionals, managers, executives and technicians. Candidates need to earn at least $5,600 a month and pass the Complementarity Assessment Framework (COMPASS).
EntrePass
For foreign entrepreneurs who are keen to start and operate a business in Singapore that is venture-backed or possesses innovative technologies.
Personalised Employment Pass
For high-earning existing Employment Pass holders or overseas foreign professionals. The PEP offers greater flexibility than an Employment Pass.
Overseas Networks & Expertise Pass
For top talent in business, arts and culture, sports, as well as academia and research.
Skilled and semi-skilled workers
Pass type
Who is it for
S Pass
For skilled workers. Candidates need to earn at least $3,300 a month.
Work Permit for migrant worker
For skilled and semi-skilled migrant workers in the construction, manufacturing, marine shipyard, process or services sector.
Work Permit for migrant domestic worker
For migrant domestic workers (MDWs) to work in Singapore.
Work Permit for confinement nanny
For Malaysian confinement nannies to work in Singapore for up to 16 weeks starting from the birth of the employer's child.
Work Permit for performing artiste
For foreign performers working in public entertainment outlets such as bars, hotels and nightclubs.
Trainees and students
Pass type
Who is it for
Training Employment Pass
For foreign professionals undergoing practical training. Candidates must earn at least $3,000 a month.
Work Holiday Pass (under Work Holiday Programme)
For students and graduates aged 18 to 25 who want to work and holiday in Singapore for 6 months.
Work Holiday Pass (under Work and Holiday Visa Programmes)
For Australian and New Zealander students and graduates aged 18 to 30 who want to work and holiday in Singapore for 12 months.
Training Work Permit
For semi-skilled foreign trainees or students undergoing practical training in Singapore for up to 6 months.
Family members
Pass type
Who is it for
Dependant's Pass
For spouses and children of eligible Employment Pass or S Pass holders.
Long-Term Visit Pass
For parents, common-law spouses, step-children or handicapped children of eligible Employment Pass or S Pass holders.
Pre-approved Letter of Consent
For eligible spouses or children of Singapore citizens or PRs holding an LTVP/LTVP+ issued by ICA. The holder is pre-approved to work in Singapore. They can only apply for a PLOC when applying for, or renewing the LTVP/LTVP+.
Letter of Consent for ICA-issued LTVP/LTVP+ holders
For eligible spouses or children of Singapore citizens or PRs holding an LTVP/LTVP+ issued by ICA. The LOC allows the holder to work in Singapore. The employer must apply for the LOC.
Letter of Consent for Dependant’s Pass holders who are business owners
For eligible Dependant’s Pass holders who wish to operate a business.
Exemptions and working while on a visit pass
Pass type
Who is it for
Miscellaneous Work Pass
For foreign speakers, religious workers and journalists taking on a short-term work assignment of up to 60 days in Singapore.
Work Pass Exempt Activities
For performing eligible short-term activities without a work pass. Candidates must still notify MOM of their activities.
Work pass exemption for foreign students
For foreigners holding a Student's Pass issued by ICA, and studying full-time at an approved school or institution.
Work passes for holders of Long-Term Visit Passes issued by ICA
For foreigners married to a Singaporean or permanent resident, or parents accompanying a child who is studying in Singapore.
Related
How do I submit work pass-related requests?
Primary Care Plan (PCP)
Employment agencies
Employment of Foreign Manpower Act
Foreign workforce numbers
Singapore Inter-Agency Taskforce on Trafficking in Persons

title: Employment Pass
content:
Employment Pass
The Employment Pass allows foreign professionals, managers, executives and technicians to work in Singapore. Candidates need to earn at least $5,600 a month. Employers must also demonstrate that they have fairly considered all jobseekers.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the pass, including who it is for, validity and pass map.
Consider all candidates fairly
You must advertise on MyCareersFuture and consider all candidates fairly before you apply for an Employment Pass.
Eligibility
Includes EP qualifying salary (Stage 1), COMPASS (Stage 2) and the Self-Assessment Tool.
Passes for family
Eligibility, which family members you can bring in and the passes available.
Documents required
Documents required to apply for an Employment Pass.
Apply for a pass
Includes how to apply for a pass and check the application status.
Appeal against a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Renew a pass
When and how to renew an Employment Pass before it expires.
Cancel a pass
When and how to cancel an Employment Pass.
Replace a pass card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen Employment Pass card.
Notify MOM of updates
When and how to notify MOM, including updating company name and address, occupation, passport details, salary and residential address.
Taking up secondary directorship
When and how to appoint a pass holder to your Board of Directors.
List of standard occupations for Employment Pass
Standard occupations for filling out the manual Employment Pass application form.
Experienced tech professionals with skills in shortage
From September 2023, experienced tech professionals with skills in shortage may apply for a longer 5-year duration EP.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for Employment Pass transactions.
Employment Pass eService
Check work pass and application status
Employment/S Pass Self-Assessment Tool (SAT)
View all

title: EntrePass
content:
EntrePass
The EntrePass allows eligible foreign entrepreneurs to start and operate a business in Singapore that is venture-backed or possesses innovative technologies. Find out what businesses are eligible, how to apply and the requirements for renewing the pass. Explore Singapore’s startup ecosystem and how it supports talented founders at
Startup SG webpage
.
Key facts
Key facts about the pass, including who it is for, validity, legislation and online services.
Eligibility
Eligibility and requirements for an EntrePass, and businesses that are not eligible.
Passes for family
Eligibility and requirements, which family members you can bring in and the passes available.
Documents required
Documents required for an EntrePass application.
Apply for a pass
Includes how to apply for a pass and check your application status.
Renew a pass
Includes how to renew an EntrePass, documents required and criteria for renewal.
Cancel a pass
When and how to cancel an EntrePass.
Replace a pass card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen EntrePass card.
Notify MOM of updates
When to notify MOM, including updating company details, occupation, passport details, salary and residential address.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for EntrePass transactions.

title: Personalised Employment Pass
content:
Personalised Employment Pass
The Personalised Employment Pass is for high-earning Employment Pass holders and overseas foreign professionals. It is not tied to an employer and offers greater flexibility than an Employment Pass.
Key facts
Key facts about the pass, including who it is for, validity, legislation and online services.
Eligibility
Eligibility and requirements of the Personalised Employment Pass.
Passes for families
Eligibility and requirements, which family members you can bring in and the passes available.
Documents required
Documents required for a Personalised Employment Pass application.
Apply for a pass
Includes how to apply, documents required and processing time.
Appeal against a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Cancel a pass
When and how to cancel a Personalised Employment Pass.
Replace a pass card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen Personalised Employment Pass card.
Notify MOM of updates
When to notify MOM, including updates to employment status or employer, passport details and declaring salary.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for Personalised Employment Pass transactions.
Employment Pass eService
Make or manage appointment

title: S Pass
content:
S Pass
The S Pass offers flexibility to employers to hire skilled workers (Associate Professionals and Technicians (APTs)) who may not meet the EP criteria, subject to a quota. New candidates need to earn at least $3,300 a month.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the S Pass, including who it is for, validity and pass map.
Consider all candidates fairly
You must advertise on MyCareersFuture and consider all candidates fairly before you apply for an S Pass.
Eligibility
Includes S Pass eligibility, assessment criteria, Self-Assessment Tool and passes for family.
Quota and levy
S Pass quota and levy requirements, paying the levy, applying for a levy waiver.
Medical insurance
Requirements for S Pass medical insurance, updating insurance details.
Paying salaries
Includes requirements and acceptable methods for paying S Pass salaries.
Documents required
Documents required to apply for an S Pass.
Apply for a pass
Includes how to apply for a pass and check your application status.
Appeal against a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Renew a pass
How to renew an S Pass before it expires.
Cancel a pass
When and how to cancel an S Pass.
Replace a pass card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen S Pass card.
Notify MOM of updates
When and how to notify MOM, including updating company name and address, occupation, passport details, salary and residential address.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for S Pass transactions.
Employment Pass eService

title: Work Permit for migrant worker
content:
Work Permit for migrant worker
Looking instead for
migrant domestic worker
?
The Work Permit allows semi-skilled migrant workers from approved source countries/regions to work in certain sectors. Find out your sector’s requirements, foreign worker levy and quota, and how to apply.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Work Permit, including who it is for, validity and pass map.
Sector-specific rules
General Work Permit and sector requirements, including eligibility, security bond, quota, levy
Foreign worker quota and levy
Foreign worker levy and quota requirements, how to pay levy, skilled worker levy and levy waiver.
Apply for Work Permit
Includes how to check the application status, and get the Work Permit issued.
Appeal against a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Renew a Work Permit
When and how to renew a Work Permit and steps to take before renewal.
Appeal for renewal
How to submit an appeal if your worker is not eligible for Work Permit renewal.
Cancel a Work Permit
When and how to cancel a Work Permit.
Replace a card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen card.
Notify MOM of updates
When to notify MOM, including updates to company name and address, occupation, passport details and residential address.
Get a short Work Permit extension
How to get your worker's Work Permit extended for a short period.
Overseas leave
Overseas leave for migrant workers, including home leave, levy waiver and what to do if they don't return.
Housing
Housing requirements for foreign workers, types of approved housing, updating foreign worker’s address to MOM.
Recreation, well-being and other resources
Find recreation centres, publications and resources for migrant workers working in Singapore.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for Work Permit for migrant worker transactions.

title: Work Permit for migrant domestic worker
content:
Work Permit for migrant domestic worker
You need to apply for a Work Permit if you are hiring a migrant domestic worker (MDW) in Singapore. Find out the eligibility requirements, how to apply and what you need to do during her employment.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Work Permit, including who it is for, validity and pass map.
Eligibility and requirements
Includes eligibility criteria for an MDW, security bond and insurance.
Employer's guide
Includes information on rest days, well-being, contracts, salary, overseas leave and sending an MDW home.
Foreign worker levy
Includes levy rate, paying the monthly levy, applying for levy concession and waiver.
Apply for Work Permit
Includes how to apply for a Work Permit and the steps to take before and after your MDW arrives in Singapore.
Apply under a special scheme
Applying under the Joint Income Scheme or Sponsorship Scheme for lower-income employers and senior citizens.
Appeal against a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Renew a Work Permit
When and how to renew a Work Permit before it expires.
Appeal for renewal
How to submit an appeal if your MDW is not eligible for Work Permit renewal.
Cancel a Work Permit
When and how to cancel a Work Permit for MDW.
Replace a card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen card.
Notify MOM
When to notify MOM, including changes in employer's information, address, MDW's passport details, pregnancy, death, missing MDW, provide a reference for your MDW, or if you would like to get a family member to act on your behalf on her matters.
Transfer to a new employer
How to transfer an MDW directly, including tasks for the new and current employers.
Transfer an MDW to a new employer through an employment agency
EAs can take over the responsibilities for your MDW while finding her a new employer.
Get a short Work Permit extension
How to extend your MDW's Work Permit for a short period.
Customer ratings for FDW-placing EAs
Find out about customer ratings for FDW-placing employment agencies.
Advance Placement Scheme
Overview of the scheme, eligibility criteria for employers and participating employment agencies. Find an EA to hire MDW trained in eldercare.
Publications and resources for employers of MDWs
An information hub of educational articles, useful publications, guides and videos for employers of migrant domestic workers (MDWs).
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for Work Permit for migrant domestic worker transactions.
Work permit transactions for domestic helpers and confinement nannies
Work Permit Online (WPOL) for employers of MDWs

title: Work Permit for confinement nanny
content:
Work Permit for confinement nanny
The Work Permit for Malaysian confinement nannies is a short-term permit usually issued for up to 16 weeks starting from the birth of your child. Find out who is eligible and how to apply for the Work Permit.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Work Permit, including who it is for and validity.
Eligibility
Eligibility for employers and confinement nannies, levy fees.
Apply for permit

Cancel a Work Permit
How to cancel a confinement nanny's Work Permit.
Extend a confinement nanny's stay
How to extend your confinement nanny’s stay if her Visit Pass is cancelled or its duration does not cover her employment period.
eServices and forms
Online services and forms for Work Permit for confinement nanny transactions.

title: Training Employment Pass
content:
Training Employment Pass
The Training Employment Pass allows foreigners to undergo practical training for professional, managerial, executive or specialist jobs in Singapore. Find out who is eligible and how to apply for the pass.
Key facts on Training Employment Pass
Overview and key facts about the Training Employment Pass, including who it is for and validity.
Eligibility
Eligibility requirements for a Training Employment Pass for foreign students or trainees.
Documents required

Apply for a pass

Cancel a pass

title: Training Work Permit
content:
Training Work Permit
The Training Work Permit is for unskilled or semi-skilled foreign trainees undergoing practical training in Singapore for up to 6 months. Find out who is eligible and how to apply.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Training Work Permit, including who it is for and validity.
Eligibility
Eligibility and requirements for levy, quota and security bond.
Documents required
Documents you need to apply for a Training Work Permit.
Apply for a Training Work Permit
Includes how to apply for a Work Permit and check the status of your application.

When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.

Replace a Work Permit card

title: Dependant's Pass
content:
Dependant's Pass
The Dependant's Pass allows spouses and children of Employment Pass or S Pass holders to join them in Singapore. Find out which family members are eligible and how to apply for the pass.
Looking instead for
dependants of Overseas Networks & Expertise Pass holders
?
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Dependant's Pass, including who it is for and validity.
Eligibility
Find out who is eligible for a Dependant's Pass for family members of Employment Pass or S Pass holders.
Working in Singapore
Find out about available work pass options for Dependant’s Pass holders who wish to work in Singapore.
Documents required
Documents required to apply for a Dependant's Pass.
Getting a pass for a newborn
Includes getting a Dependant's Pass for a baby born in Singapore and extending a Special Pass if needed.
Apply for a pass
Includes how to apply for a pass and check the application status.
Appeal a rejected application
When you should appeal, who can appeal and how to submit an appeal.
Renew a pass
When and how to renew a Dependant's Pass before it expires.
Cancel a pass
When and how to cancel a Dependant's Pass.
Replace a pass card
How to replace a lost, damaged or stolen Dependant's Pass card.
Notify MOM of updates
How to notify MOM of changes to residential address and personal details.

title: Letter of Consent for ICA-issued LTVP/LTVP+ holders
content:
Letter of Consent for ICA-issued LTVP/LTVP+ holders
You can apply for a Letter of Consent to work in Singapore if you are an LTVP or LTVP+ holder who is the spouse or unmarried child of a Singaporean or PR. Find out the eligibility requirements and how to apply.
Key facts
Overview and key facts about the Letter of Consent, including who it is for and legislation.
Eligibility for Letter of Consent for ICA-issued LTVP/LTVP+ holders
Eligibility requirements for a Letter of Consent to work in Singapore.

Apply for a Letter of Consent for ICA-issued LTVP/LTVP+ holders
